episodeTitle: Is Escape Possible?!? God's Challenge is Set in Motion!
episodeTitleJapanese: 脱出なるか！？動きはじめた神の試練！
episodeTitleRomanized: Dasshutsu naru ka!? Ugokihajimeta kami no shiren!
description: The Straw Hats become separated when a massive Super Express Speed Shrimp captures half the crew aboard the Going Merry. Meanwhile, Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp learn from Pagaya about the divine trials awaiting their friends at the Sacrificial Altar in Upper Yard.

events.title: Nami Convinces Crew to Flee Skypiea
events.description: After being declared criminals by the White Berets, Nami attempts to persuade the crew to leave Skypiea immediately. However, her efforts are complicated by Luffy's stubborn desire to visit Upper Yard.
events.significance: Establishes the tension between safety and adventure that drives the Skypiea arc, showing the crew's conflicting priorities.

quotes.text: We need to leave this place now before things get worse!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami trying to convince the crew to escape after being marked as criminals

events.title: Luffy Refuses to Leave Without Visiting Upper Yard
events.description: Despite the danger and Nami's pleas, Luffy insists that he won't leave Skypiea until he's visited Upper Yard, the forbidden holy land.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's characteristic stubbornness and sense of adventure, which ultimately leads to the crew's involvement in Skypiea's conflict.

quotes.text: I'm not leaving until I see Upper Yard!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring his intention to explore despite being criminals

events.title: Crew Gathers Supplies from Pagaya's Home
events.description: Luffy requests food supplies from Pagaya's house while Usopp asks for ship repair materials. Pagaya generously agrees, and Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp head to gather these items.
events.significance: Shows the hospitality of Skypiea's citizens and sets up the crew's separation.

events.title: Super Express Speed Shrimp Appears
events.description: A massive crustacean known as the Super Express Speed Shrimp emerges from beneath the Going Merry and begins pulling the ship away with Zoro, Nami, Robin, and Chopper still aboard.
events.significance: Introduces one of God's servants and initiates the crew's forced participation in the divine trials, separating the crew into two groups.

events.title: Pagaya Explains God's Judgment System
events.description: Pagaya reveals the nature of God's judgment to Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp. Those who become sacrifices face one of two divine judgments: becoming a sacrifice or facing an ordeal administered by God's priests.
events.significance: Establishes the fundamental mechanics of Enel's control system in Skypiea and explains the trials system that will challenge the Straw Hats throughout the arc.

quotes.text: People who become sacrifices receive one of two judgments of heaven - either the sacrifice or the ordeal.
quotes.speaker: Pagaya
quotes.context: Explaining God's judgment system to the remaining Straw Hats

events.title: Crew Members Taken to Sacrificial Altar
events.description: The Super Express Speed Shrimp, identified as a servant of God, transports Zoro, Nami, Robin, and Chopper toward the Sacrificial Altar at Upper Yard where they will face God's trials.
events.significance: Forcibly brings the Straw Hats to Upper Yard and sets up the upcoming confrontations with Enel's priests.

events.title: Luffy Decides to Rescue His Crew
events.description: Upon learning that his crewmates have been taken to face God's trials, Luffy declares that all they need to do is beat the priests, showing his characteristic confidence and determination.
events.significance: Sets Luffy's resolve to confront God's forces and rescue his crew, driving the narrative forward into the main Skypiea conflict.

quotes.text: All we have to do is beat those priests! Things just got interesting!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Responding to news that his crew has been taken to face God's trials

events.title: FAITH Ending Theme Debuts
events.description: Episode 157 marks the first use of 'FAITH' by Ruppina as the ending theme for One Piece, replacing the previous ending song.
events.significance: Beginning of a new ending theme era that would accompany the Skypiea arc through episode 168.

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between the Straw Hats' desire for freedom and adventure versus the authoritarian control system imposed by God Enel.
themes.symbolism: The Super Express Speed Shrimp represents the inescapable reach of divine authority in Skypiea.

themes.description: Despite the danger, Luffy immediately commits to rescuing his captured crewmates, demonstrating unwavering loyalty.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's refusal to flee represents his core character trait of never abandoning friends.

themes.description: The episode introduces the concept of God's judgment and trials, exploring themes of theocratic authority and forced penance.
themes.symbolism: The Sacrificial Altar represents the absolute power Enel holds over Skypiea's inhabitants.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his characteristic stubbornness and loyalty, refusing to leave Skypiea and immediately committing to rescue his captured crew.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime adds extended scenes of the crew's discussion about leaving Skypiea that are more condensed in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'FAITH' by Ruppina as the ending theme, which would continue through episode 168.
The episode was directed by Ken Koyama with screenplay by Junki Takegami, adapting pages 2-17 of Chapter 243 of the manga.
This episode aired on June 15, 2003 in Japan, during the height of the Skypiea arc's original broadcast.
The Super Express Speed Shrimp is one of several creatures serving under God Enel that help enforce his divine authority over Skypiea.
